column4: i was installing ubuntu and now when i boot to my regular windows, i get a grub error 21. what should i do? grub recovery?
what error do you get booting ubuntu
ok - that means the partition that the options in /boot/grub/menu.lst are pointing at the wrong partitions
okey dokey, what can i do to fix?

you need to boot either boot a livecd and mount /boot from your install to play with menu.lust and change the partitions to the correct options (you'll find them in device.map in your boot/grub directory)
or you'll need to edit the grub menu directly - which is more complex
do you get the grub menu ?
i am a noob to this, so it there a manual or something that says what i can do?
how do i open a terminal from a UbuntuCD?
i am on the main screen of the cd when i first boot up
applications menu, then the accessories menu
